Package com.stehno.ersatz.impl

Class ErsatzRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.stehno.ersatz.impl.ErsatzRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Request
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ErsatzRequestWithContent
    public class ErsatzRequest
extends java.lang.Object
implements Request
    Request implementation representing requests without body content.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ErsatzRequest​(HttpMethod meth, org.hamcrest.Matcher<java.lang.String> pathMatcher, ResponseEncoders globalEncoders)  
      ErsatzRequest​(HttpMethod meth, org.hamcrest.Matcher<java.lang.String> pathMatcher, ResponseEncoders globalEncoders, boolean noResponse)
      Creates a new request with the specified method, path matcher and optional empty response flag (defaults to false).

        Parameters:
        meth - the request method
        pathMatcher - the path matcher
        globalEncoders - the shared global encoders
        noResponse - whether or not this is a request with an empty response (defaults to false)

      • header

        public Request header​(java.lang.String name,
                      java.lang.String value)
        Description copied from interface: Request
        Specifies a request header to be configured in the expected request. The value specified must match one of the request header values mapped to the expected header name. Multiple header specification may be added to the expectations; each specified header must exist in the request. If an OR-style match is desired a Hamcrest Matcher should be specified (see the header(String, Matcher<Iterable<String>>) method).
        Specified by:
        header in interface Request
        Parameters:
        name - the header name
        value - the header value
        Returns:
        this request

      • header

        public Request header​(java.lang.String name,
                      org.hamcrest.Matcher<java.lang.Iterable<? super java.lang.String>> value)
        Description copied from interface: Request
        Specifies a request header matcher to be configured in the expected request. If multiple matchers are defined with this method, each must match successfully for the request to be matched.
        Specified by:
        header in interface Request
        Parameters:
        name - the header name
        value - the header value matcher
        Returns:
        this request

      • query

        public Request query​(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String value)
        Description copied from interface: Request
        Used to specify a request query parameter to be configured in the expected request. As per the HTTP spec, the query string parameters may be specified multiple times with different values to denote a parameter with multiple values.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        name - the parameter name
        value - the parameter value
        Returns:

      • query

        public Request query​(java.lang.String name)
        Description copied from interface: Request
        Used to specify a valueless request query parameter to be configured in the expected request. As per the HTTP spec, the query string parameters may be specified multiple times with different values to denote a parameter with multiple values.

        This is equivalent to calling query(name, null).

        Specified by:
        query in interface Request
        Parameters:
        name - the parameter name
        Returns:
        this request

      • called

        public Request called​(int count)
        Description copied from interface: Request
        Configures a call count verifier such that the number of calls must be equivalent to the provided count. This is analogous to calling called(equalTo(n)).
        Specified by:
        called in interface Request
        Parameters:
        count - the expected call count
        Returns:
        a reference to this request

      • matcher

        public Request matcher​(org.hamcrest.Matcher<ClientRequest> matcher)
        Description copied from interface: Request
        Configures a matcher for the ClientRequest, which allows ad-hoc matching based on the request. This does not disallow using other matcher methods, but be careful to consider any potential overlaps or unintended exclusions.
        Specified by:
        matcher in interface Request
        Parameters:
        matcher - a matcher based on the ClientRequest object
        Returns:
        a reference to this request

      • verify

        public boolean verify​(long timeout,
                      java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit)
        Used to verify that the request has been called the expected number of times. By default there is no verification criteria, they must be configured using one of the called() methods.

        This method will block until the call count condition is met or the timeout is exceeded.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout duration
        unit - the timeout duration units
        Returns:
        true if the call count matches the expected verification criteria

      • matches

        public boolean matches​(ClientRequest clientRequest)
        Used to determine whether or not the incoming client request matches this configured request. All configured matchers must return true in order for the match to be successful. By default, all request have a matcher for request method and request path, the others are optional.
        Parameters:
        clientRequest - the incoming client request
        Returns:
        true if the incoming request matches the configured request

      • getRequestMatchers

        public java.util.List<RequestMatcher> getRequestMatchers()
        Used to retrieve the configured matchers in the request.
        Returns:
        an immutable list of the configured matchers.

      • addMatcher

        protected void addMatcher​(RequestMatcher matcher)

      • getCurrentResponse

        public ErsatzResponse getCurrentResponse()
        Used to retrieve the current response in the response list (based on the call count). The last response in the list will be sent to all future calls.
        Returns:
        the current response

      • mark

        public void mark​(ClientRequest cr)
        Used to mark the request as having been called. Any configured listeners will be called after the call count has been incremented.
        Parameters:
        cr - the client request to be marked

        public java.lang.String toString()
